string.text: Greetings. Who are you?

Greetings to you. I'm ex-Military. I do a little trading, but my product is very specific - embryos for activating mutants. I also sell Psi-antidotes and serum - very rare and useful items in the Zone!
Yes, I've heard of military men becoming dealers. It can't have been easy in the Ukrainian army, but I bet you've seen a lot. What's your name? I'm known as 'Marked One'

My name is Akim. I'm pleased to be acquainted. Yes, it's a rough life in the military, and the retirement pension is even worse. So now I buy, trade, and resell. I charge what I believe something is worth, and I don't bargain, so please don't ask. I've come to the Zone to make some money, then I'll get out of this hellhole. Stalkers sometimes sell artefacts in the form of a Shell - they can activate anomalies. Look at your PDA - there should be some information there for you. Oh, I have a colleague in the Agroprom northern complex who sells wares similar to mine - he's full of of useful information. And if you're looking for work, there's a guy I know who's settled down by the helicopter in the Forgotten Forest
Listen, I heard about an amazing suit. When you're wearing it you can sneak up real close to an enemy - close enough to even steal from them. Have you heard of it?

Yes, I know of it. Only, it's not a suit - it's an Exoskeleton. I know it went missing after the last scientific expedition to the Zone's center. You can safely assume that it's now in the possession of the Bandits. My intelligence officer told me it's in the ATP. I sent a squad there once to retrieve it, but I never heard from them again. I can't spare any more men at the moment, but I do know that it's in the attic of one of the buildings. If you could find this exoskeleton for me, I would be very grateful!
I can't guarantee anything, but if I'm in that area I'll have a look around for it. If I do find it, though, I may need to use it for a while, if you don't mind...
A whole squad? It sounds like a dangerous area. You'd be better finding someone else. I have other business - like staying alive...
Greetings, Akim. I've found your Exoskeleton. It's as good as you described!
Yes! You've brought it?
Here you go...
Well done, my friend! And here's something to express my gratitude!
Greetings, and who are you?
Greetings to you. I'm known as Adrenalin, the local dealer. I specialise in unique items such as capsules, which create anomalies. I also sell rare serums, and antidotes for Psi-related illnesses
Ah yes, Akim yold me about you. He asks if you still jack up all your prices?
So Akim hasn't forgotten his old friend! You'll be pleased to know that my prices are decent. You'll also find that my goods are quite specific, and out of the ordinary...
Greetings, Adrenalin. I'm looking for better weapons to help me get to the center of the zone. Can you help?
Greetings. I can't offer much in weaponry, other than a really good sniper rifle
Sounds expensive. My money and artefacts are in quite short supply at the moment...
Money wouldn't be enough for this rifle! But if you're willing, there's a way you can earn it...
I'm interested. What do you need?

I need you to visit the scientist in Yantar, Sakharov. Mention the Military commander who does business with him. I have an order for a Minigun I need you to pick up. It's a simple enough job, but a heavy weapon to carry...
I could really use a decent sniper rifle, and this doesn't sound too dangerous. Okay, I'm up for it
I don't want to give myself a hernia, dragging that thing across the Zone. I mean, if we only had a wheelbarrow, that would be something - but by myself, no way!
Hi, Adrenalin
Did you bring the weapon?
Yes, and you weren't joking about the weight. I must have lost several kilos myself...
Excellent, Marked One! Here's your sniper rifle, and an artefact as a bonus for keeping your word so quickly
I'm looking for work. Do you have any jobs?
Work? You've definitely come to the right place - I've got plenty of it. First, though, let's see if you've got the stomach for what I need. Bring me 10 intact zombie hands. You up for that?
Oh! I've not been asked for those before. What line of work are you in?
It's a strange old strange world, Stalker, and by the look of you I'd say you're financially challenged at the moment
It certainly is a strange world - even more so if you can't remember who you are...
Well, Stalker, do I have a new runner? If you want advice on zombie hunting, the time-honoured method is to shoot 'em in the head. Works every time!
Ah, where have I heard that before? Yeah, I'll take the job
Zombie hunting? That wasn't the kind of work I had in mind. No way...
I've got your ten zombie hands. It was somewhat disconcerting watching the nails continue to grow while they were in my backpack...
Oh yes, they'll be a good inch longer by now! I'll have to give them a manicure before I ship them out! Thanks, and here's your reward
If you don't mind, while you're doing your nails, I'd like to wash out my backpack...
Sure, go ahead. Oh, and you really need to buy a new knife - it looks like the hands have been chewed off...
I'm ready for my next job, Mr. Frankenstein

Oh! Have you acquired some new armor, or have you just had a shower? You're starting to look like a normal Stalker!\nThere is a job, now you mention it. I've learned of some documents that'll enable me to create something really useful...
No body parts, then. It sounds good already. What do I need to do?
No body parts this time. That was just to see how determined you were. Now, I just need these documents
Okay. Where are they?
They've been hidden on a roof, somewhere in the Garbage. Could be a building, a bus, a shipping container - I've no idea, since I can't read the other part of the note I came across...
Paper? On a roof? Wouldn't it be easier to say 'somewhere in the Garbage'? This could take some time...
An old piece of paper on a roof, somewhere in the Garbage? Have you seen the size of that junk pile? There's fucking paper everywhere! No way...
I risked my life for this piece of paper. I hope it was worth it...
I said it was on a roof. How dangerous can it be on a roof?
Do you know how many different types of 'roof' are out there? Anyway, the job's done
I'm very grateful, and here's your payment
I need resources for a long journey into the Zone, so I've come for more work, if you have any. The barman's got none, and won't give me credit either...

You'll get none from me either. Stalkers are not exactly a good insurance risk. Especially ones like you...\nI do need your help, though, and you've proved yourself good at this. Those documents you brought from the Garbage are only the first half of the complete file. There's another part...
And you need that, too?
You catch on quickly...
Okay, where are they hidden?
You may not like this, but probably in the Agroprom underground
I'll do my best to find them, but I think I should be paid more than last time...
You're ex-military, Akim, and probably know the area, and the risks, better than I do. You should go yourself...
Here are your documents. A more precise location would have helped. I may not know my name, but I'm pretty sure it's not Sherlock...

Oh, you've crinkled them. Next time please fold them neatly, and put them carefully into a waterproof compartment in your backpack. Don't just stuff them into your pockets! Here's your reward, anyway...
What the f...? Have you ever been in those tunnels? Seen how fucking creepy they are? And the things living down there in the dark? Even the Military are too sca... you're winding me up, aren't you?
Calm down, my friend. You're very easy to wind up!
Hello Akim. How's business? I was expecting to see many Stalkers lining up to buy your goods, but it seems I'm the first in the queue. And the last...

Greetings, Marked One. It's not about the quantity, but the quality of the sale, and of the customer.\nOnce again, I could use your help. X-18 in the Dark Valley. I can't find anybody willing to go there. I'd go myself, but I'd lose business...
X-18! You know that area is Mecca for all Bandits? Do you have a plan for me getting me in and out of there? And will it pay enough to cover my aftercare?
There's a lot of money involved here, Marked One. At least, potentially. Help me out with this, and I promise to do whatever I can to help you fulfil your own goals...
Okay. Let's have the details...

Well, studying the second part of the documents has led me to believe there's a third part. Somebody named Korchagin previously had this third document, and he divided it discretely into four parts, no three of which are any use without the fourth. In X-18 there should be three of these parts. The fourth is somewhere outside the lab, but still within the compound. That's all I know, but I need them all. I promise you my gratitude will have no limits!
No limits, eh? Okay, leave it with me...
The last underground lab was bad enough, even knowing the document was inside. This is impossible. You're going to have to find someone else
Here are your documents. It wasn't easy, and took far longer than I expected
Excellent work. Now I can start processing the contents...
Akim, I'm very pleased for you, but aren't you forgetting something? Like your limits?
Ah, my sincere apologies. My enthusiasm got the better of my manners. Please take this - you certainly earned it!
Greetings, Akim. I trust you've caught up with all your bedtime reading?

Greetings, Marked One. I see your worry lines from X-18 have almost disappeared!\nI need your services again. This time to Lab X-16, for one more document. And to find a PDA from Borov's base in the Dark Valley
You gonna tell me why you need all these documents? I mean, what's my motivation?
Let's just say that I have my reasons, and you'll find out in due course. In the meantime, you can regard it a test of faith...
Okay, but if I'm going to put my life on the line, I'd like to know it's for a just cause, that's all. What are the details?

My mistake. I thought that after X-18 you were not on good terms with your mind. Now I can see it's a condition you've had since birth...
On to the business at hand - the documents you brought back from X-18 appear not to be the final part after all. But it did shed light on another document, plus a PDA holding the associated data.
The document should be in the control room of Lab X-16, and the PDA was stuffed somewhere around the crane at the front of Borov's base.
One last thing - I need one of each of these protection suits: 
a Military SKAT-10, a Stalker Exoskeleton, a Bandit Exoskeleton, and a Duty PZ9D Universal. Can you do all this?

A document somewhere underground, a PDA somewhere outside, and you want me to update your shop as well? You sure you don't want to add Cinderella's slipper to the list? Okay, but it's going to take a lot longer...
That's at least two jobs, not one, and in Bandit territory. Sorry, but no...
Right, where would you like all this gear?

Wow! I didn't expect you to find it all! Well, you've earned the right to know what I've learned. The documents should help me obtain a new type of Exoskeleton. There's a prototype hidden somewhere in the Zone. I'll give you the details, but don't lose them, sell them, or tell anyone. This is incredibly confidential information - and when you find the item, you'll understand why! Good luck!
Thank you! I do appreciate clear instructions. Not the gobbledegook you often get in this game...
Then we understand each other. When you find it, let me know how well it works...
Greetings, my friend. Have you sold anything since I saw you last?

Greetings, Marked One, and I'm still of the opinion that you had multiple problems as a child...\nLook. Do you think you could find me a part of every common mutant in the Zone? Everything except zombie hands, that is - I have enough of them for now. This should be a relatively easy task for you
One of each? Are you opening a museum? Or a 'Throw up as much as you want' buffet for your clients?
One day, one way or another, you will leave the Zone. When you do, may I suggest that you save time and not apply for the job of stand-up comedian? In your own interests, of course...
By the time I leave the Zone, I'd expect to be prepared and equipped for anything and everything...

Not a hostile audience at a night club in Kiev, you won't. Trust me on this...\nListen, it's about time you visited the Doctor. You need a good enema to clear out the brains that are clogging up your arse. I'll recommend you to him - after you've brought back those body parts
I've a Whirligig capsule here that'd make a really good enema for you. I'd even be happy to administer it!\n Don't worry, I'll get your mutant parts
No, I'm fed up with all this running about like a fucking rookie
Greetings, Akim. You now have a full set of mutant parts, and I need to wash my backpack again...
What's this? I asked you to bring parts, not the whole mutant. Didn't you get yourself a new knife?
Look, it's easier to slice the main joint, and pull the whole thing off by the lower limb. That way, the part you want doesn't get damaged. I aim to do a good job...
Yes, you certainly do... Here, take your reward
Greetings. What the hell are you doing way out here by yourself?

Greetings, Stalker. My name is Crest. I'm here for the peace and quiet. And the artefacts, which are beautiful but not bountiful - but since very few people come here, I'm happy with the ones I find each day. You know that each area produces its own types of artefact? Well, there are several that don't grow well here - most notably the Medusa, Stone Flower, and Fireball. I'm trying to collect five of each type. Would you be interested in helping me find them, maybe even from elsewhere? I know it's a big job, but I'll make it worth your while...
Fifteen artefacts? That's a big task for any Stalker, and not the kind of long term job I'd normally take on...
Yes, it's a big job, but I promise you the reward will be worthwhile. After all, artefacts are my speciality...
I don't know. It's a lot of radiation to be carrying around in one go...

Well, there is another thing. Look around you. Other than the mutants, I'm the only one here, and I know this place like the back of my hand. If you ever need to come here for any reason, I'm someone you can trust - and that's an uncommon thing in the Zone. Make the right friends, and you never know how useful they might be in the future
You're right about deceit and betrayal in the Zone, and I can understand why you spend your time alone. Don't worry - I'll get you your artefacts...
I really think you'd be better travelling a bit further afield, and collecting them yourself...
Greetings, Crest. Here are the artefacts I promised. To be honest, I'm glad to be finally rid of them...
Thank you, Marked One! I hope you stashed them while collecting them all. That much radiation can cause problems, including impotence...
So I've heard, but also that most Stalkers don't live long enough to marry!

True. Many come here to get rich, to become powerful, to see themselves immortalised in some manner, but in the end the Zone takes them in one way or another.\nAs I said, I'm a man of my word. Here's the reward I promised you
Greetings

Greetings, my friend. Listen - yesterday, the Military came here and took all my artefacts! Well, at least the ones I didn't have stashed! They also took my vodka! I'd like to punish them in some way - make them realise what they've done...
Bastards. Those guys are supposed to protect the place from scumbags, but most of the time they're the problem...\nBut it's not that simple. They didn't kill you, and I'm not a killer for hire...

Oh, I'm not asking you to kill anyone! I just need some of their weapons. Six Anomalous Bisons should be enough, then I can hire some men to give them something to think about next time they plan to raid anyone!
Anomalous Bisons aren't cheap, and I don't kill people just for their weapons. How quickly do you want them?
There's no rush. I'll give you 40,000Ru, plus an additional reward. How you get them is up to you...
Okay, I'll do it. That's a lot of money, and I've actually picked up a couple of those Bisons on my travels already. Most likely I'll find more...
No, I'm not messing with the military. Any sign of trouble and these bastards call in helicopter support. Then there's no escape...
Here are your Bisons. I hope they do what you wanted
Fantastic, Marked One! Here's your reward
Thank you, Hey, those weapons are really something! Trust me, I've been in their sights more times than I care to remember!
I'm just glad you survived it. There's a shortage of good men in the Zone...
I'm amazed you're still alive. Have you achieved some kind of Oneness with the Zone, or were you just raised by Werewolves?
I like your sense of humour, Marked One. Good to see the Zone hasn't taken it yet. I have another task for you. Ah, your eyes just lit up!
What can I say? I appreciate artefacts. What do you need?

There's a military man who went missing in these woods. He has a teleporter I'd like to examine. I know he stayed around here last night because the teleporter's defective. On his radio he described his position as being next to some large stones and a newly-abandoned car. I met a Stalker yesterday who said his car had broken down in the northern part of the woods. It's not far from here. If you can find the soldier and bring me the teleporter, I'll reward you as usual for it
Hang on! If it's not far from here, why are you sending me? What's up there?
Look, I don't travel to that area. People go missing there. This teleporter is very important to me. It's a necessary risk...
You mean a necessary risk for me to take... Okay, I'll try to find it for you
Crest, you told me you knew this place like the back of your hand. You really should do this yourself...
I've found the teleporter, only it doesn't work. Here...
I knew you'd try to use it, and I did say that it didn't work. I'll repair it. What happened to the military man?
Looks like he was killed by mutants, and recently too...

Thanks, Marked One, and here's your reward. By the way, under the teleporter's cover is a stamp that says 'Prototype 2'. Meaning there's another one somewhere, and probably still in the Zone. If you find and recognise it, it's yours. Judging by the markings, both devices were made in the ATP, so that's where I'd start looking. There's something else - by monitoring the local Bandits' radio frequency, they're expecting to be raided by the Military soon, so they've hidden their best loot. You might want look in the rubbish containers in the ATP - you're bound to find find something there...
